en.main_menu_tag: A game about the Pythagorean theorem
en.screen1_desc: Pythogoros Theorem can be proved in various ways. We shall cover a simple one today that uses re arrangement.
en.screen2_desc: Lets look at the above arrangement of triangles of sides a, b & c.
en.screen4_desc: The area of the BLUE square on the left equals the sum of the areas of the two BLUE squares on the right. That's what Pythagoras' theorem states!
en.fin_desc:
FIN!

 Thank you for learning with us!
en.screen01_desc: The Pythagoras Theorem applies to all right triangles and states that the square of the hypotenuse (longest side opposite the right angle) is equal to the sum of the square of the other two sides. a²+b²=c²
en.screen02_desc: Lets check this for a right triangle of sides of lengths 3,4 and 5.
en.screen03_desc:
The converse of the Phthagoras theorem is used to determine if a triangle is a right triangle. It uses the relationship between the lengths of the legs and hypotenuse to prove a right angle.
Look at the above values. What do you notice?
en.screen04_desc: The above mentioned values form right triangles. 6²+8²=10² 12²+16²=20² 15²+20²=25²
en.gameInfo2:
Help the Neon Ship travel as far as possible.
You will be presented with the values for sides of a triangle. You have to check if they form
a right angled triangle.
en.gameInfo3:
Tap right side of the screen if they form a right angled triangle.
Tap the left side of the screen if they dont form a right angled triangle.
en.gameInfo4: Answer as many correctly as possible in 60s to travel further!
en.gameInfo5: Careful! Three wrong answers will end the game.
